choices.text:
what are the catagories of figures of speech?
Figures Of Speech can be classified into three categories, namely; 
1. Simile - a figure that compares two things using words such as "like", “as" or similar adjectives and verbs 
 2. Metaphor- the use of one thing to represent another (often an abstract idea) in which there is no literal similarity between them  3. Personification: attributing human qualities, actions etc., to nonhuman things
